question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [State sync DB corruption] At lines 162-166, can the state sync metadata checkpoint be corrupted to cause nodes to re-sync from malicious peers after restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [Unwrap panic] At lines 147, 155, 159, 166, do the .unwrap() and .expect() calls create DoS vectors where attackers can trigger panics during checkpoint creation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [Atomic checkpoint failure] Between lines 150-166, if checkpoint creation fails midway, does the function leave partial checkpoints that could be loaded as valid, causing state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [Working directory confusion] After set_data_dir at line 142, can other threads still access the old directory causing race conditions in concurrent database operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [Sharding config mismatch] At line 153, can enable_storage_sharding be manipulated between source and checkpoint to cause data corruption when loading sharded vs non-sharded databases? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: initialize_database_and_checkpoints()] [Checkpoint timing attack] At lines 183-185, can an attacker exploit the test-only checkpoint creation to inject malicious data before database initialization, affecting production if improperly configured? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: initialize_database_and_checkpoints()] [Bootstrap failure handling] At line 190, if bootstrap_db() fails, does error propagation prevent partial initialization that could leave the node in an exploitable state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: initialize_database_and_checkpoints()] [Waypoint extraction bypass] At line 201, does genesis_waypoint() properly validate the waypoint is from genesis and not a later epoch, preventing waypoint confusion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: initialize_database_and_checkpoints()] [Return tuple integrity] At lines 198-204, can attackers exploit the tuple return to swap components (e.g., wrong backup_service with wrong db_rw) causing security violations in calling code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: initialize_database_and_checkpoints()] [Timing side-channel] At lines 188-196, does the debug timing log expose sensitive information about database size or structure that attackers could use for reconnaissance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: initialize_database_and_checkpoints()] [Mutable config exploitation] Since node_config is &mut at line 173, can attackers exploit config mutations to change security-critical settings after validation but before use? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [Symlink attack] At line 141, can attackers use symlinks in node_config.storage.dir() to redirect checkpoint to attacker-controlled locations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Storage path validation] At line 63, does FastSyncStorageWrapper::initialize_dbs() validate directory paths to prevent creation of databases in sensitive system directories? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Channel race condition] At lines 56-61, can multiple threads race on the watch channel creation causing duplicate senders and inconsistent version updates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Fast sync state transition race] At lines 75-98, between temporary DB and fast sync DB operations, can concurrent state sync operations cause inconsistent database states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Expect panic exploitation] At line 84, can attackers trigger conditions where genesis ledger info doesn't exist, causing validator crashes during initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Expect panic DOS] At line 88, can get_latest_ledger_info_option() be made to fail, causing panic and preventing node startup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: create_rocksdb_checkpoint_and_change_working_dir()] [Checkpoint panic chain] At lines 155, 159, 166, can cascading checkpoint failures leave the system in an unrecoverable state requiring manual intervention? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Fast sync mode bypass] At line 63, can attackers manipulate node_config to force fast sync mode even when database is not empty, causing data loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Temporary DB persistence] At lines 76-77, can the temporary DB with genesis be manipulated to persist beyond its intended lifecycle, causing state confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Fast sync provenance break] At lines 80-84, if epoch 0 ledger info is missing or invalid, can nodes establish fast sync without proper genesis provenance? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Genesis commit bypass] At line 93, can commit_genesis_ledger_info() be called multiple times or skipped based on race conditions in the is_none() check? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/storage.rs] [Function: bootstrap_db()] [Either type exploitation] At lines 63-99, can attackers exploit the Either<AptosDB, FastSyncStorageWrapper> type to confuse calling code about which database type is actually returned? (Medium)
